00024 void Fatal(const char* msg, ...) {
00025   va_list ap;
00026   fprintf(stderr, "ninja: FATAL: ");
00027   va_start(ap, msg);
00028   vfprintf(stderr, msg, ap);
00029   va_end(ap);
00030   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00031   exit(1);
00032 }
00033 
00034 void Error(const char* msg, ...) {
00035   va_list ap;
00036   fprintf(stderr, "ninja: error: ");
00037   va_start(ap, msg);
00038   vfprintf(stderr, msg, ap);
00039   va_end(ap);
00040   fprintf(stderr, "\n");
00041 }
00042 
00043 bool CanonicalizePath(string* path, string* err) {
00044   // WARNING: this function is performance-critical; please benchmark
00045   // any changes you make to it.
00046 
00047   // We don't want to allocate memory if necessary; a previous version
00048   // of this function modified |path| as it went, which meant we
00049   // needed to keep a copy of it around for including in a potential
00050   // error message.
00051   //
00052   // Instead, we find all path components within the path, then fix
00053   // them up to eliminate "foo/.." pairs and "." components.  Finally,
00054   // we overwrite path with these new substrings (since the path only
00055   // ever gets shorter, we can just use memmove within it).
00056 
00057   const int kMaxPathComponents = 20;
00058   const char* starts[kMaxPathComponents];  // Starts of path components.
00059   int lens[kMaxPathComponents];  // Lengths of path components.
00060 
00061   int parts_count = 0;  // Number of entries in starts/lens.
00062   int slash_count = 0;  // Number of components in the original path.
00063   for (string::size_type start = 0; start < path->size(); ++start) {
00064     string::size_type end = path->find('/', start);
00065     if (end == string::npos)
00066       end = path->size();
00067     if (end > start) {
00068       if (parts_count == kMaxPathComponents) {
00069         *err = "can't canonicalize path '" + *path + "'; too many "
00070             "path components";
00071         return false;
00072       }
00073       starts[parts_count] = path->data() + start;
00074       lens[parts_count] = end - start;
00075       ++parts_count;
00076     }
00077     ++slash_count;
00078     start = end;
00079   }
00080 
00081   int i = 0;
00082   while (i < parts_count) {
00083     const char* start = starts[i];
00084     int len = lens[i];
00085     if (start[0] == '.') {
00086       int strip_components = 0;
00087       if (len == 1) {
00088         // "."; strip this component.
00089         strip_components = 1;
00090       } else if (len == 2 && start[1] == '.') {
00091         // ".."; strip this and the previous component.
00092         if (i == 0) {
00093           *err = "can't canonicalize path '" + *path + "' that reaches "
00094             "above its directory";
00095           return false;
00096         }
00097         strip_components = 2;
00098         --i;
00099       }
00100 
00101       if (strip_components) {
00102         // Shift arrays backwards to remove bad path components.
00103         int entries_to_move = parts_count - i - strip_components;
00104         memmove(starts + i, starts + i + strip_components,
00105                 sizeof(starts[0]) * entries_to_move);
00106         memmove(lens + i, lens + i + strip_components,
00107                 sizeof(lens[0]) * entries_to_move);
00108         parts_count -= strip_components;
00109         continue;
00110       }
00111     }
00112     ++i;
00113   }
00114 
00115   if (parts_count == slash_count)
00116     return true;  // Nothing to do.
00117 
00118   char* p = (char*)path->data();
00119   for (i = 0; i < parts_count; ++i) {
00120     if (p > path->data())
00121       *p++ = '/';
00122     int len = lens[i];
00123     memmove(p, starts[i], len);
00124     p += len;
00125   }
00126   path->resize(p - path->data());
00127 
00128   return true;
00129 }
